intro: Kentrophyllum coeruleum, commonly known as the blue kentrophyllum, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant features small, blue-violet flowers that bloom in clusters, adding a striking visual element to its appearance. Its leaves are finely divided and often used in traditional herbal medicine for their purported health benefits. Kentrophyllum coeruleum thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade.
